'''Thomas John (Tommy) Gore''' (born 26 November 1953) is an [[English people|English]] former [[Association football|footballer]].
==Playing career== ===Wigan Athletic=== Gore played as a youth for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] before joining [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] in January 1974.<ref name=gorewigan>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/article554499.ece|title=Gore and glory|last=Hodkinson|first=Mark|date=August 13, 2005|work=The Times|accessdate=2009-04-10}}</ref> He made 185 Northern Premier League appearances for Wigan before the club gained its [[The Football League|Football League]] status.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.yeoldetreeandcrown.co.uk/modules/news/article.php?storyid=57 | title=Latics A-Z | accessdate=10-09-2010}}</ref> He played in the club's first ever Football League game, and was an ever-present in the side throughout the club's first season. In 1980, he scored the winning goal for Wigan against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the third round of the [[FA Cup]]. He was suddenly transferred to [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] in October 1980, having made 102 consecutive league appearances since the club's first Football League fixture.
===Port Vale=== Gore joined [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] from [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] in July 1983. He played 44 first-class games for ''the Vale'' in a twelve month period following his debut in August 1983. However in August 1984 he suffered a [[neck]] injury, which forced his retirement two months later.<ref>{{cite book|last=Kent|first=Jeff|title=Port Vale Personalities|publisher=Witan Books|page=114|year=1996|isbn=0952915200|url=http://www.amazon.ca/Port-Vale-Personalities-Jeff-Kent/dp/0952915200}}</ref>
==Post-retirement== After retiring, Gore owned and ran a [[snooker]] club in [[Wigan]] for eight years. He now lives in Billinge and runs a cleaning company providing cleaning services on board ships.<ref name=gorewigan />
